str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
